transcript: are such a diplomat that it is really tiresome," said Natasha in a morti- fied voice that trembled slightly. (She used the word "diplomat," which was just then much in vogue among the children, in the special sense they attached to it.) "Why does she bother me?" And she added, turning to Wra, "You'll never understand it, because you've never loved anyone. You have no heart! You are a Madame de Genlis 1 and nothing more" (this nickname, bestowed on Wra by Nicholas, was considered very stinging),
